nl.tno.stormcv.batcher

Interface IBatcher

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DiscreteWindowBatcher, SequenceNrBatcher, SlidingWindowBatcher

    public interface IBatcher
extends Serializable
    Batcher implementations are responsible to partition a provided set of CVParticle items into zero or more batches of items suitable for batch processing. Batcher's get a List with received CVParticles which they must create batches for and a BatchInputBolt.History reference used to remove CVParticles from when they are no longer needed (results in an ACK for that particle). The overall process works as follows:
    • BatchInputBolt receives a CVParticle and selects the right 'group' to add it to (for example streamId)
    • The group is sorted based on sequence number
    • The sorted group and History are provided to the Batcher implementation
    • The batcher creates zero or more batches, removing particles from the History when they are no longer needed
    • Each batch is provided to the IBatchOperation implementation which results in zero or more CVParticles to be emitted
    • Each CVParticle is anchored on the received Particle and emitted
    Implementations typically base their results on the items received (size of the set, some particular ordering etc) but it is also possible to partition the input based on external criteria like a clock (all items received within one minute) or a specific 'marker' item received.
    Author:
    Corne Versloot
